Polisi Sopir Tambora yang Tabrak Mahasiswa Saat Demo Ricuh Ditahan 21 Hari
02 Nov 2019, 17:09 by Hermawan Mappiwali
Makassar - Bripda IA dan Bripda AA, yang mengemudikan kendaraan taktis Tambora dan diduga menabrak mahasiswa serta driver ojek online (ojol) saat demo ricuh di Makassar, Sulawesi Selatan, dijatuhi sanksi disiplin. Keduanya ditahan selama 21 hari.
"Kedua anggota (polisi) dimaksud dihukum patsus (penempatan khusus) selama 21 hari dan tidak diperbolehkan mengikuti pendidikan selama 6 bulan ke depan," ucap AKP Abdul Rahman, selaku polisi penuntut dari Propam Polda Sulsel, ketika dimintai konfirmasi detikcom, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
AKP Rahman mengatakan Bripda IA dan Bripda AA menjalani sidang disiplin di Mapolda Sulsel, Jumat (1/11). Namun kedua polisi tersebut tidak langsung menjalani hukuman.
"Dilengkapi administrasinya dulu, baru dilaksanakan patsusnya," ujarnya.
Kedua polisi terhukum di atas mengejar massa ricuh dari flyover menuju kantor Gubernur Sulsel, Jl Urip Sumoharjo, pada Jumat (27/9). Dua korban tertabrak Tambora saat itu masing-masing adalah mahasiswa dari Universitas Bosowa (Unibos) Dicky Wahyudi dan driver ojol Irfan Rahmatullah. Kedua korban masih dirawat.
Kedua polisi tersebut dianggap melanggar Pasal 4 huruf A dan huruf D Peraturan Pemerintah RI Nomor 2 Tahun 2003 tentang Peraturan Disiplin Anggota Polri.

Tambora Driver Police Who Hit Students During Ricuh Demo Detained 21 Days
02 Nov 2019, 17:09 by Hermawan Mappiwali
Makassar - Bripda IA and Bripda AA, who drove Tambora's tactical vehicle and allegedly crashed into students and online motorcycle taxi drivers (ojol) during a riot demonstration in Makassar, South Sulawesi, were disciplined. Both were held for 21 days.
"The two members (police) referred to were sentenced to Patsus (special placement) for 21 days and not allowed to attend education for the next 6 months," said AKP Abdul Rahman, as the prosecuting police of the South Sulawesi Regional Police Propam, when asked for confirmation from AFP on Saturday (2 / 11/2019).
AKP Rahman said Bripda IA and Bripda AA underwent a disciplinary hearing at the South Sulawesi Regional Police Headquarters on Friday (1/11). But the two policemen did not immediately undergo punishment.
"Equipped with the administration first, then the patsus will be implemented," he said.
The two police convicted above chased a rioting crowd from the flyover to the South Sulawesi Governor's office, Jl Urip Sumoharjo, on Friday (27/9). Two victims were hit by Tambora at the time, each of them a student from Bosowa University (Unibos) Dicky Wahyudi and ojol driver Irfan Rahmatullah. Both victims are still being treated.
The two police officers were considered to have violated Article 4 letter A and letter D of Government Regulation No. 2 of 2003 concerning Discipline Regulations of Polri Members.
